PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

A work of organization in the province

Saskatchewan Archives

No. 2

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire to pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences as another. Impossible for you to answer so don't worry about answering others may prove impossible. If there is not sufficient space, please write to give details or describe particular events, if they apply to answer the questions.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1934, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experiences of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Pioneer Life: Past and Present," has been sent to you and will be sent to you.

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire on other subjects will be prepared at a later date. Some of these are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer.

All questionnaires

- Pioneer health conditions
- Pioneer social life, sports and recreation
- Pioneer housing
- Pioneer education and churchwork
- Pioneer farming experience

Execution of Questionnaire

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives Board Office at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the provincial records of the Province. Please send your completed questionnaires to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Regina, SASK.

My brother called with me & my wife came in 1893

23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to recount?

We worked hard & had no homes until we reached Ogden. It was very difficult and not being properly clothed or fed.

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (For business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? How far?

Travelled with friends and then I was alone. After 20 years I had a family. We often went to town or to church or to visit friends.

25. What was your occupation?

I worked on the railroad and then I was a farmer.
23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to recount?

We worked hard and had no leisure, but we were happy.

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (For business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? For how long?

I traveled with others and then I traveled alone. We often went on trips for weeks at a time.
